name: 2.02.3.3. Move 5 Feet through Difficult Terrain
content:
@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.OiNttXSDW598DIEs]{(Index) Combat Rules}

@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.q5bgNObausAXw2UA]{2.02.3. Full-Round Actions}

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.8cm2RntAmLLlg7nz]{2.02.3.1. Full Attack}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.EQdgZgwMQkFK2adC]{2.02.3.2. Cast a Spell}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.pHyKz8UQhg8FImjY]{2.02.3.3. Move 5 Feet through Difficult Terrain}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.adrsWQRvBNEI4q1M]{2.02.3.4. Run}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.sDdDsMio3YkKR36L]{2.02.3.5. Use Special Ability}
  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.A0PE1jTg1M6hXYax]{2.02.3.6. Withdraw}

Source PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 188

In some situations, your movement may be so hampered that you don’t have sufficient speed even to move 5 feet (a single square). In such a case, you may spend a full-round action to move 5 feet (1 square) in any direction, even diagonally. Even though this looks like a 5-foot step, it’s not, and thus it provokes attacks of opportunity normally.
